resources.string: Do you want to stop the server?
Do you want to clear the summary screen?
Do you want to clear the terminal sreen?
Do you want to disconnect the client?
Your Device does not have Internet Connection.
The server is running in the address
Check to disable bridge to serial device.
The port is occupied by another program.
Number of bubbles in the Summary Scroll
Number of lines in the Terminal Scroll

1)			Create a TCP Server by pressing the button "PLAY" using the default device IP and port number.


• If you want to start the server with a different port:


Step 1: Click the button on the upper right corner (more icon).
 Step 2: Click the Settings menu.
 Step 3: Click on the "port number" option.
 Step 4: Enter in the text field, the port number.
 Step 5: Click OK.



2)			Use an OTG cable to connect a USB device to your phone or tablet.

 The phone or tablet detects the device connected to the USB and asks if you want to run it.


• Before connecting a device, you can configure serial communication by entering the menu section of SERIAL COMMUNICATION.
 • The server continues running without the connection of a USB device.
 • Also, you can communicate with your USB device without running the server.



3)			Then use programs or applications of Telnet Client Terminal to connect to the server. So you can communicate with your device or other clients.

 • The data flow is displayed on the SUMMARY panel.
 • The TERMINAL panel is separated to send and receive data from the USB device.



SERVER COMMANDS:

 Send special text strings from client to server to specify orders.


Before, you have to enable the sending of commands in the client options. The client options are found by clicking on the item in the client list located in the toolbar.


"<TS>"
 Check the connection to the server responding with the sequence "OK".


"<SN> <[parameter]/>"
 Set name to client. 
 Example: <SN><John/>. The client will be referenced with the name John. If set correctly the server responds with the sequence "OK".


"<LC>"
 Returns the list of client names connected to the server in the following format:
 <LC> <client1> <client2> ... <clientN> </LC>


"<UC><[parameter]/>[text sequence]"
 The text sequence is addressed to the client indicated in the parameter space. No response.
 Example: <UC><Paul/>Hello John!
 The text string will be send "Hello John!" to the client with the name "Paul".


"<BC><[text sequence]>"
 The text string will be send to all clients connected to the server.
 Example: <BC> Hello!
 The text string "Hello!" will be send to all clients.
